summary: This is a federal indictment against correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas for conspiracy and making false records related to their failure to conduct required inmate counts and rounds at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 9-10, 2019. The indictment details how their dereliction of duty resulted in no monitoring of the Special Housing Unit (SHU) during the period when inmate Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide.

events.description: MCC officers, including Michael Thomas, found Epstein in his SHU cell with a strip of bedsheet around his neck. He was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Failure to Perform Counts and Rounds
events.description: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas failed to perform mandated institutional counts and 30-minute rounds in the SHU, instead falsifying count slips and sleeping or browsing the internet.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Body
events.description: At approximately 6:30 a.m., Noel and Thomas discovered Epstein's body in his cell after serving breakfast. He had committed suicide by hanging overnight while unobserved.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC, ninth floor
keyFacts: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas are charged with conspiracy and making false records for failing to conduct any inmate counts or rounds in the MCC's Special Housing Unit from approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9 to 6:30 a.m. on August 10, 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide by hanging in his SHU cell during the period when no counts or rounds were conducted due to the defendants' dereliction of duty.

The defendants falsified count slips for five institutional counts (4 p.m., 10 p.m., 12 a.m., 3 a.m., and 5 a.m.) and over 75 separate 30-minute round entries, leading the MCC to believe inmates were being monitored.
Video surveillance confirmed that the last time anyone approached Epstein's tier before his body was discovered was at approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9, 2019.

Epstein had been placed on suicide watch after a prior incident on July 23, 2019, and was supposed to have a cellmate per psychological staff direction, but was alone in his cell on the night of his death.
